Name: Grilled Potatoes
Steps: 01. Take a pan add water boil it for 2min after that add potatoes boil it for 2to 3min. After that remove it wash it with cooled water. After that remove skin.
02. Next step take a griller heat it & take a potatoes apply oil on it make it fry on griller.
03. Next step after frying and grilled it apply salt,red chilli powder, chat masala powder spread it to over all to grilled potatoes.
04. Serve with ketchup.

Name: Kodubale
Steps: 01. Peel and clean garlic.
02. Pound garlic and green chili together and keep aside.
03. Soak chana dal for 20 mins.
04. Heat kadai, add water to it. Then add haldi oil, salt, pounded garlic and green chili, soaked chana dal and 2tbsp of sesame seeds and let it boil.
05. Then rice flour to it and mix properly.
06. Then switch off the gas and let it stand for 10 mins.
07. Then remove to a plate and let it cool down. After cooling down knead the dough.
08. Heat oil in a kadai. Spread sesame seeds in a plate
09. Now divide the dough into lemon size balls. Then roll it like a rope and roll on the sesame seeds and then join it like a bangle
10. Repair all the balls like bangle and keep aside
11. Heat oil in a pan deep fry these bangles till crisp
12. It should be consumed immediately.

Name: Jalapeno Poppers
Ingredients: 12 ounces jalapeno peppers, seeded and halved
Steps: 01. In a medium bowl, mix the cream cheese, Cheddar cheese and bacon bits. Spoon this mixture into the jalapeno pepper halves.

02. Put the milk and flour into two separate small bowls. Dip the stuffed jalapenos first into the milk then into the flour, making sure they are well coated with each. Allow the coated jalapenos to dry for about 10 minutes.
03. Dip the jalapenos in milk again and roll them through the breadcrumbs. Allow them to dry, then repeat to ensure the entire surface of the jalapeno is coated.
04. In a medium skillet, heat the oil to 365 degrees F ( 180 degrees C). Deep fry the coated jalapenos 2 to 3 minutes each, until golden brown. Remove and let drain on a paper towel.

Name: Air Fryer Stuffed Mushrooms
Ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package whole white button mushrooms
¼ cup finely shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
Steps: 01. Using a damp cloth, gently clean mushrooms. Remove stems and discard.
02. Mince scallions and separate white and green parts.
03. Preheat an air fryer to 360 degrees F (182 degrees C).

04. Combine cream cheese, Cheddar cheese, the white parts from the scallions, paprika, and salt in a small bowl. Stuff filling into the mushrooms, pressing it in to fill the cavity with the back of a small spoon.
05. Spray the air fryer basket with cooking spray and set mushrooms inside. Depending on the size of your air fryer, you may have to do 2 batches.
06. Cook mushrooms until filling is lightly browned, about 8 minutes. Repeat with remaining mushrooms..
07. Sprinkle mushrooms with scallion greens and let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Name: Spinach Rolls with Puff Pastry
Ingredients: 1 clove clove garlic, minced, or more to taste
1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
Steps: 01. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook garlic until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in spinach and cook until warmed through, 3 to 5 minutes; season with salt and mix well. Transfer to a bowl and mix in feta cheese.
02. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheets.

03. Lay 1 sheet of puff pastry on a lightly floured surface and cut in half lengthwise. Roll 1 half out with a rolling pin so it is wide enough to fold twice lengthwise. Mix egg and milk together in a small bowl.
04. Spread 1/6 of the spinach mixture lengthwise in the center of the puff pastry. Roll one side over the filling and brush the other side with egg-milk mixture. Roll over again to seal.
05. Brush top of roll with egg-milk mixture and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Cut roll into 6 small rolls. Repeat with the remaining puff pastry. Place cut rolls onto the prepared baking sheets.
06. Bake in the preheated oven until spinach rolls are puffed up and golden, 20 to 25 minutes.
